creator: MattAuSupport

content:
At this time the Thunderbird project does not offer an email address, only a client to retrieve mail from your existing mail address(es)

See https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/04/thundermail-and-thunderbird-pro-services/

Personally I would suggest you use GMX.com for an email address. A privacy policy that us the envy of those outside the EU and being a German company (a subsidiary of 1 and 1) certain privacy issues just do not exist with them. They ask very little and retain even less of your personal information. But it is always up to you to choose your own supplier. I am just personally supportive of the folk at GMX.

However if you are paying for domain registration you probably need to pay for email hosting for those domains and as you do not want to use Google with whom your chosen provider pertness and supplies email addresses for you might want to consider changing hosting providers for your domain

Network solutions (a squarespace competitor) has this discussion on the pros and cons of using squarespace. https://www.networksolutions.com/blog/pros-cons-squarespace/ Clearly the article will be biased towards the network solutions offering. However the cons reported appear to be fairly commonly reported elsewhere.
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: anekblair

content: The send button only becomes active if the address is valid. That means is must have an account (the part before the @) and a fully qualified domain. The part after the @ So matt@example.com would be valid. Matt@ would not, nor would any of a dozen other formatting choices. The most problematic typographic issue I see with folk entering email addresses is they include a leading space or a trailing space (tap the space bar) which make the address invalid.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: First, be sure to enter full email address including the @ and remainder of address Second, I suggest trying combinations of 465 and SSL/TLS or STARTTLS and then 587 with SSL/TLS or STARTTLS as port 25 is insecure. That may not work, but it has for many users where they had been using port 25 for their accounts. Yours is the first I've seen, though, for eclipse.

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

1 Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo 2 Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle 3 Riavviare Thunderbird 4 Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale 5 Riavviare Thunderbird 6 Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella problematica -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

NOTA: I passaggi descritti ai punti 2, 4 e 6 possono richiedere anche diverso tempo a seconda delle dimensioni degli archivi da elaborare.

creator: abdurrehmanrajpout

content:
Yes, that's easy.

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk
